thread.title: London attracts a record audience for IEEE ICC 2015
thread.title_full: London attracts a record audience for IEEE ICC 2015

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: London attracts a record audience for IEEE ICC 2015
text:
London attracts a record audience for IEEE ICC 2015 London attracts a record audience for IEEE ICC 2015 Details Category: Venues & Events Created   12:15 IEEE, International Conference on Communications (ICC), attracted its largest audience of nearly 3,000 industry professionals, scientists, academies and government officials to its annual conference held at ExCeL London from 8-12 June 2015.Dedicated to the research, advancements and implementations of the next wave of wired and wireline technologies, IEEE ICC 2015 hosted more than 2,500 presentations and panels from leading researchers and industry experts exploring the entire communications spectrum. 
In addition, the event featured 1,600+ original paper presentations, 20 tutorials, 27 workshops, 7 keynotes, 1 CTO forum, 17 industry panels and various social events. “As one of the most competitive cities in the world, London was selected as the host city for 2015 said, Dr. Jiangzhou Wang, Executive Chair of the IEEE ICC 2015 conference. Commenting on why IEEE chose London, Dr. Wang said “The city is a very attractive tourist destination and business centre with an excellent and cost effective transportation system. It provides a gateway to Europe and the rest of the world, with 2,000 direct flights per week to London from major cities. With its rich history, London is also one of the most attractive cities in the world. In addition to providing numerous local iconic attractions for conference attendees to explore, London’s Tech City, the fastest growing technology cluster in Europe, is a huge draw for the communications community. Partnering with the ExCeL London team allowed for a successful event in terms of logistics and assisting with the advanced publicity of the event.” Andrew Swanston, Head of Sales – Conferences & Events, adds: “We are delighted that IEEE Communications Society (ComSoc) selected ExCeL London to host its 2015 event. This is representative of a trend we are seeing, with an increasing number of North American Meeting Planners now choosing London for their events. Currently 25% of all conference and event business at ExCeL comes from North America, with other clients including Aviation Week, Microsoft, Salesforce.com, CFA Institute and Cisco.” Related articles
